snippet: Thousands of laid-off workers have started their own businesses or have been recruited by other tech companies lured to Finland by its surplus of talent.
abstract: Finland faces unique unemployment problem as thousands of skilled tech workers laid off by Microsoft and Nokia, telecommunications giant that once accounted for large segment of nation's economy, look for jobs; politicians are  issuing grants, starting entrepreneurship programs and developing training to help tech workers transfer to other industries or start their own companies; policies have already significantly reduced unemployment in nation's tech sector.
lead_paragraph: Thousands of laid-off workers have started their own businesses or have been recruited by other tech companies lured to Finland by its surplus of talent.

headline.main: After Nokia Layoffs, Tech Workers in Finland Regroup and Refocus
headline.print_headline: In Finland, Tech Workers Refocus After Cuts at Nokia
